intro: Sida weberbaueri, commonly known as the Weberbauer's sida, is a flowering plant species native to Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy stems and alternate leaves. Its flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and often have five petals. Sida weberbaueri is characterized by its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and arid environments.
